attributes.action: drop the draft consultation proposing legislation stating that ISPs should cut off Internet access for those who share copyrighted music files over the Internet.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The draft legislation, which will force internet service providers (ISPs) to cut off Internet access to those who share files illegally on the Internet are impractical and against the public interest. They would turn Internet service providers into an invasive Internet 'police force' which would limit the public's freedom to access information digitally.

rejection.details: There is no such draft legislation.
reasons: Potentially libellous, false, or defamatory statements
